abstracts.cdata!:
The Sahel Integrated Lowland Ecosystem
            Management Program (SILEM) will provide support for
            environmental and natural resource management related
            activities of the Community-Based Rural Development Project
            (CBRDP). The potential environmental and social impacts of
            CBRDP and SILEM will vary in significance according to the
            size and strategic influence of sub-projects. Potential
            environmental and social risks of SILEM are in the areas of:
            planning for land use; exclusion of vulnerable social groups
            or disadvantaged groups from planning or distribution; soil
            and water management; displacement of population or
            non-agricultural species; dependence on seed distribution;
            pressure on land and water resources, biodiversity, or
            cultural properties; potential conflict among participants;
            health and environmental risks (especially associated with
            agro-minerals and organic manure); and potential for
            involuntary resettlement issues. The report sets forth an
            Environment and Social Management Framework (ESMF) to be
            used to avoid, manage, or mitigate the above impacts and
            whose details will be integrated into the sub-project cycle.
